newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria budget deficit up to 187 bln levs Dec 30.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria budget deficit up to 187 bln levs Dec 30.

text.p: Bulgaria's central government budget deficit rose 24.3 billion levs to 187 billion levs between December 18 and December 30, or 90.8 percent of the revised annual target, preliminary Finance Ministry figures showed.
Final figures for end-December could be expected next week,
BULGARIA BUDGET DEFICIT, bln levs DEC 30 DEC 17

At the beginning of December, Bulgaria's parliament passed a second revision of the 1996 budget, raising the spending target to 564.238 billion levs from 438.932 billion to help cover a 125.3 billion lev gap in interest payments on domestic debt.
The largest part of the increase was funded through a 15-year 115-billion lev direct loan from the central bank.
The deficit target was raised to 206 billion levs, or five to six percent of GDP, from 80.715 billion levs. The revenue target was not revised.
Domestic debt rose to 1.053 trillion levs at the end of December from 345.4 billion levs a year earleir. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
